exercise.title: Systems Overview
exercise.name: systems_overview
exercise.shortdescription: Review of the common OS components for memory analysis.
exercise.description: This exercise covers the important aspects of the hardware architecture and common operating system components.
exercise.tutorial:
This exercise will cover common operating system components and hardware architectures, which will give you a decent baseline of knowledge for conducting memory analysis. It covers Chapter 1 in The Art of Memory Forensics, which you can access with your Safari Books Online Account.

Review Chapter 1 and answer the questions below.

question.text: What component assists the CPU in address translation?
When dealing with raw, padded memory dumps, a physical address is an offset into the memory dump file.

question.answer: 64-bit CPUs only actually use 52 bits of the available address space
question.wrong: IA32 architecture is also known as x86
Physical Address Extension (PAE) allows up to 64GB of physical memory
A typical page size is 4KB, but it can be larger if the page size entry (PSE) flag is set

question.text: Which CPU register is used to store the directory table base (page directory base)?

question.wrong: Paging allows processes to "see" more RAM than is physically present
The page fault handler code must never be paged
Paging complicates memory forensics because not all data is memory resident at the time of acquisition
Paging writes potentially valuable volatile evidence to non-volatile storage such as disk
